description.narrative: (i) Contributing to further improving infrastructure development and strengthening the capacity of the construction sector and related activities, a key growth and local sustainability area for the Balkans in the long-term (ii) Supporting employment and enabling entrepreneurial opportunities through increased operational efficiencies at energy consumption, resource utilization, etc. (iii) Contributing and safeguarding income to the Governments through taxes as a result of the plants'' operations and continuous performance improvement (iv) Supporting and strengthening local SMEs by promoting sub-contracting at local level and investing in their continuous performance improvement

Titan Cement Company S.A. (Titan Group, the Group or the Sponsor), an existing IFC client and Greeces leading private cement company, is seeking to expand its cooperation with IFC by inviting IFC to invest in its Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia (FYROM), Kosovo, and Serbia operations. These operations mainly consist of three entities: Cementara Kosjeric (TCK), Cementarnica Usje (TCU), and SharrCem (TSC) (together, the Companies) that have a combined production capacity of about 3.5 million tons per annum (mtpa) and are engaged in an investment program which also includes environmental improvements and various debottlenecking investments in all plants (the Project).

name.narrative: The Project sites are located at three different plants: TCK, TCU and TSC. TCK Titan Cementara Kosjeric D.O.O. is located around 130 km South-East of Belgrade and has an annual production capacity of about 800,000 tpa of cement. TCU Titan Cementarnica Usje A.D. is located in Skopje and has an annual production capacity of about 1.7 mtpa of cement. TSC-SharrCem SH.PK is located in Hani Elezit, Kosovo and has an annual production capacity of about 1.0 mtpa of cement.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
